high.$description: interaction emphasis theme identifier. Referenced by components to apply standard interaction emphasis colors for buttons and interactive elements.

low.$description: interaction emphasis theme identifier. Referenced by components to apply subdued interaction emphasis colors for secondary or contextual interactive elements.

normal.$description: Normal inversity theme identifier. Referenced by components to apply normal contrast polarity.

flipped.$description: Flipped inversity theme identifier. Referenced by components to apply inverted contrast polarity for emphasis.

emphasis.$description: Footer uses muted interaction emphasis theme override

We on purpose lower the interaction emphasis of all buttons inside Infobox and use the muted colors defined in semantic/color/emphasis/muted. This token can not be used in Figma due to Figma restrictions. In this case, the token is static and does not react to dark/light mode.

inversity.$description: Fatal variant of the Infobox is flipped in both lighntess modes - dark and light.

emphasis.$description: Popover uses muted interaction emphasis theme override
